_header: Lordings lief and dear listeneth to me a stound
Note: A redaction of 6677, with 114 lines not found there.
Subjects: evils of the times; satires; contemporary conditions
_description: ‘Symonye and Covetise’, on the evil times of Edward II — 414 lines in tail-rhyme stanzas

Bod48.First Lines:
Lordynges leue & dere listneþ to me a stoundeOf a newe
                    reste þat nwlich was y founde…
Bod48.Last Lines:
…& euer to serue god þe bet for þat y haf ȝow
                    seiþ nowþe& come to hym þat fore vs was to þe iwes
                    soldy told
Bod48.Editions:
Hardwick,  Charles. 
             A Poem on the times of Edward II
Percy Society
         28. London: Richard, 1849. 
Ross,  Thomas W. 
             “On the Evil Times of Edward II. A new version from Ms Bodley
                48.” 
             Anglia
         75 (1957): 173-93: 177-93.
